head_text.subj: EXT. NEW YORK CITY SKYLINE NIGHT
THE NEW YORK CITY SKYLINE AT NIGHT,
MASTER KWAN'S SCHOOL, A RAMSHACKLE B

text: His is the only one still    occupied, and it doesn't loo permanent. In the window    is a cardboard, handwritten s "Kwan's Shaolin Kung Fu".    What remains visible behind the security grate is an    IMPRESSION of people moving a around.

The students are doing their own thing, and they are a mi and young, men and women. They are not dressed alike, as be in a Karate school: they are dressed in old T-shirts a sweat pants. This is not a wealthy school, by any means, typified by the appearance of SIFU KWAN, who is walking t students as they train. He is wizened old man, 70 years o a day, and he is dressed in a fraying Chinese jacket, scr shoes and a discolored Chinese T-shirt.
Struggling through a horse stance, his face in real pain. trying his best to hold the stance, but his legs are quiv drops out of the stance onto his knees. Master Kwan is ri him.
Sifu Kwan, was that long enough? It's been 10 minutes... Sifu Kwan shakes his head and puts his hands behind his b walks past the student.
At Shaolin Temple, in misty Songshan mountains, We monks trained in iron palm until our hands bled... (beat)
... then we trained some more. He walks on, leaving a puzzled student behind.
(getting back into horse stance)
I guess not...
As he walks around the different people training. As one moving through an intricate series of movements, he sighs rearranges her hands.

Tiger grasps his tail, not hamburger! He    moves on, studying the room with his eyes, often gl the    door, and then toward the small clock on a table n It    is late, and Kwan is obviously waiting for someone he    is waiting, a young STUDENT comes up to Kwan.
Master Kwan, when can I learn flying kicks? I see Bruce Lee...

Bruce Lee actor, we fighters, warriors. A sparrow in flight is beautiful, but a side kick to the ribs is effective. Show me. The boy shrugs    and then    starts throwing side kicks. looking at the    boy and    half looking towards the doo The boy throws    three or    four kicks and then stops. Kwan watching    the door.    Kwan sees him, and turns ba
(shaking his head)

A Shaolin warrior lets nothing intrude. Continue, never mind. He continues to kick, and Kwan continues to look at the d Finally, the student stops kicking, half-heartedly bows t master, and then moves to the side of the workout room. K know he's gone. Kwan turns around, forgetting for a momen doing, and comes face to face with the mother of a studen RODRIGUEZ, and she is holding a uniform of some sort. She widely at him and holds up the uniform. It is beautiful, hand made, and on the back is embroidered: "Kwan's Shaoli underneath that is "Drew Carson". Kwan takes in the entir while the rest of the class is gathering around to have a are all very impressed. KWAN (CONT'D)

Never in my days at the Shaolin Temple have I seen uniform as beautiful as this. Thank you, Mrs. Rodriguez. I wish Drew were here to thank you himself. Ta ma de! This last he says looking at the empty door. MOTHER
I only hope it brings him luck in the tournament. KWAN

Luck is no concern, Mrs. Rodriguez. Shaolin warriors depend on heart and soul  that's how they saved the T'ang emporer. He looks again at the door, then claps his hands together his students around him. KWAN (CONT'D)
Xie Xie, Mrs. Rodriguez. (to class)

During my time training at the Shaolin Temple, the birthp martial arts, I was lucky (glance at Mrs. Rodriguez)... e fortunate to have the best instructors in the world train there was also time for individual training  where skills like the blade of a sword. Now, it is that time for you. He turns to go. One of the students, before he can leave, clears his thro STUDENT 2
What do you want us to do? KWAN
When the blind follow the blind, they both fall over the cliff. Understand? STUDENT 2
No. The others mutter "No" and shake their heads, confused. KWAN
No matter. He exits, leaving his students staring vacantly after him They look at each other, honestly not knowing what to do.
It is kind of spooky, and there are no lights on outside. candlelight inside, and it is moving around  an effect no ghost carrying a candelabra.

The area is dilapidated, but very clean, with all kinds o and Chinese paraphenalia lying around. Around the corner spooky light, and (with music building to a crescendo), w CARSON, a    muscular 16/17 year old, bowls of flaming wa shoulders,    moving through the garage, practicing his k maneuvers.    He is kicking, punching, etc., occasionally wax on his    skin (INSERT). In the background is a TV, and on it is showing a martial
Who is quietly settling into a shadowy corner of the gara Drew.

As he continues to move around the workout area, his arms moving as he tries to match the movements on the TV. Suddenly, Kwan jumps out of the shadows, attacking. Drew instantly, evading the attack, the wax sloshing around in but not spilling (INSERT SHOT HERE). Kwan continues the a Drew evades, their movements matching the movements on th move for move. It is a beautiful ballet, and Drew ends it Kwan down to the ground. When Kwan hits the ground, hard, lit by the TV screen.
Who, for the first time, sees that it is Kwan. DREW

He hurries over to his master, a concerned look on his fa He leans down to help Kwan up, forgetting about the bowls It pours down on Kwan, scalding him, as well as running d chest. Kwan struggles to get up, while at the same time t wipe the hot wax off. DREW (CONT'D)
Master Kwan! I'm sorry, very sorry! KWAN (blustering)
I'm OK, never mind! What are you doing anyway?
Is taking the glued-on cups of wax off his shoulders, whi the already hard wax off his chest. DREW
Practicing. I saw it in this movie... Kwan shakes his head and walks over to Drew, standing in him. KWAN
Why didn't you come to class? Why waste time with this... Should study tapes of opponent. DREW
I'll still win. Besides, the Shaolin monks never had tapes to study... they did it this way... right? KWAN
Not quite  our drills at the temple had meaning. If we had tapes, we would have watched them. Drew starts to protest, but Kwan doesn't even let him sta KWAN (CONT'D)
"The    warrior who knows himself and his opponent will w 100    times in 100 battles." Study the tapes I gave you. All    these years of one on one training  you're the bes I've    ever taught. DREW
The best? KWAN
Best white boy, maybe. Just fight like a Shaolin warrior the rest will take care of itself. (picks up tape)

Face reality, before it breaks your jaw! Drew holds out his hand for the tape, and Kwan slaps it i hand. Drew smiles a defeated smile and turns toward the V Drew's stepfather, BOB, walks in. He is a big, overweight is very angry. BOB (shouting)
Are you screwing around with this stuff again? DREW
Look, Bob, I'm not bothering you, am I? BOB
It's your attitude that bothers me, son. DREW
I'm not your son, Bob. Lay off. It is a threat, one that Bob almost takes up. Kwan feels in the room, and starts to say something. BOB
(cutting him off) Don't say a word, yellow man.
Closing his already opened mouth. BOB (CONT'D)
You're here because I told your Mom I'd see you were taken care of... after. At least respect my wishes, and make something of yourself... Stop wasting your time! DREW
(sarcastic) When I'm the best fighter in the country, I'm not going to let you be part of my entourage... BOB
You mean when you're in jail... DREW

Just leave me alone, Bob, OK? I NEVER asked for anything from you. He spins and kicks one of the hanging bags, then walks ou workout room, leaving Bob and Kwan standing alone. Kwan looks at Bob, who towers over him, and smiles sheepi KWAN
Pressure. Big tournament this weekend. He starts to walk out, but Bob follows him. BOB
How would you have liked having to take care of a kid you never really wanted... ? KWAN
I wish I had the chance... Kwan exits, and we...
