text: As he knocks out an opponent.
Applauding.
Taunting a different opponent. Trevor executes a beautifu and puts the guy down and out.
(Psychologist, therapist, masseur, etc.) who are cheering
As he plays with the next fighter.
They said you were good... ha! He knocks the guy out with a picture perfect kick. There denying that he's a superior fighter.
Can't you get me any quality sparring partners? The next guy comes up, but before they can start, the psy DR. PFEELGUT, calls for "Time" and motions Trevor over.

It's    not enough just to win, Trevor. You have to destr your    opponent completely, mentally and physically. Bea him    once, he's a threat. Humiliate him, and he'll fear you    forever. Trevor listens to this, nods his head once, and when Pfee leave, Trevor pushes him into the pool. Pfeelgut comes to the surface, smiling.

Exactly! Trevor goes back to the ring. He really takes it      to alternately playing with him and hurting him. As      the hold his own, the string to his pants comes loose      an fall down. He grabs for them with both hands, and      Tr back up, laughing with the rest of the group.
Toweling off, who is yelling to Trevor.
Trevor looks at him for a moment, not really understandin what the psychologist is saying. He lunges immediately fo (in SLOW MOTION) knocks the guy out while he is still try his pants up.

head_text.subj: CROWD AS THEY ENJOY THE SHOW IMMENSELY

text: Trevor has learned the lesson of the day, and he walks of

head_text.subj: TREVOR BEING PAMPERED BY HIS ENTOURA

text: The masseur is massaging his shoulders, a woman is doing and another is doing a manicure. An exercise physiologist over a computer print out with Trevor, when an old Korean MASTER KIM, comes into the room. TREVOR
Ah, Master Kim. (to physiologist) I'll look at these stats later. Trevor indicates a seat near him, much lower than the one sitting in. The Korean master prefers to remain standing. TREVOR (CONT'D)
Are all you guys named Kim? So, what did you think? KIM
(thick accent) You velly good fighter... TREVOR (CONT'D)
Learn English, will ya? And, tell me something I don't know... KIM
A mountain lion doesn't ponder his weakness, and is therefore vulnerable. TREVOR
(after a beat) Well, I'm pretty damn tired of this fortune cookie crap. (beat) You're history. Chaunce, get ride of the bum. The butler, CHAUNCY, comes forward and walks up to Master CHAUNCY
Very good, sir. TREVOR
Don't come here any more, you hear? Over a little more to the left, Sam. The masseur nods and adjusts his technique accordingly. TREVOR (CONT'D)
It's hard being me, you know. So much pressure...
People are streaming into the large building. The marquee reads "Diamond Nationals".
(SOME IDEAS, NOT IN ORDER)

Competitors warming up (wall front stretch, very high; on kicking another in the head  tap, tap, tap; two man routi practicing  another one jumps in?; two beautiful girls sp crowd assembling; group of kids waiting  call comes over address system, they run off; stand outside selling high equipment; different styles of fighter's clothes  camo, s stripes, "headhunter"; stern 9 year old girl doing kata; barely seen through their safety equipment fighting furio twins doing identical kata; breaking; etc.)
Walk into the area  Drew is dressed in the ill-fitting ha by Mrs. Rodriguez. People recognize him as he walks past.
Making his entrance. He is in a perfectly laundered and p and his assistant is carrying another suit pressed and re COMPETITOR
Hey, Trevor! What's the 2nd uniform for? TREVOR
The finals. COMPETITOR (after he's gone)
Cocky bastard...
As he wins a fight.
As he wins.
Drew watching, as he wins again.
Winning. The stage is set for the finals.
Drew and Trevor are already inside, waiting. Drew fights mosh of gear (different colors, different makes), while T decked out in designer, personalized gear. ANNOUNCER

Fighting for the Grand Championship: Trevor Gottitall and Drew Carson. 3 rounds, max point. Gentlemen, bow to the ref, to each other... The referee gives them a signal and the fight begins. Dre his own, but Trevor is scoring. After several flashy move is over. Score: 6 - 1. We see Trevor's cheerleaders cheering.
Where he is given mineral water to drink, his shoulders a etc.
Kwan sheepishly offers him a sip of water from a battered 2nd round: Drew's getting beaten worse than the first rou he tries works. The score at the end of the round is 15 - of Trevor.
Drew is exhausted, frustrated and worried. Trevor is pump to go on forever. KWAN
You only lose if you give up.

The psychologist is exhorting him to destroy Drew. Trevor on his padded stool, smiling. The 3rd round starts. In this round, Trevor is destroying making him look ridiculous. A clinch comes, and (INSERT HERE) before they can break, Trevor grabs the dra around Drew's waist and pulls. They face off ("20 seconds" comes the call), and Trevor c Drew blocks, his pants begin to sag. Trevor, not trying t just trying to keep Drew's hands busy, keeps coming. Drew's pants drop lower and lower. When they get around his knees, he finally notices them, down to get them. Trevor drives and picks him up in a thr effectively showing Drew's bare ass to the world. CUT AWAY to crowd laughing, girls shocked, cameras poised recording, one mom puts her hands over her daughter's eye Trevor dumps Drew and scores the final point, just as tim A buzzer goes off, signaling the end of the round. Trevor thrusts his fists into the air in celebration. Dre crawl out of the ring, and everyone is watching him.
As he is being interviewed by tv reporters. TREVOR
I was never worried. He's no match for me. I just hope the 2nd place trophy is a belt! Crowd laughs, Trevor's entourage laughs the hardest.
As he packs up his stuff.

head_text.subj: DREW AND KWAN WALKING ALONG A BRIDGE
NEW YORK NIGHT SKYLINE IN THE B.G.

text: They are not talking, they are just walking, Drew kicking contemplating the future, and the past.

Kwan's hand COMES INTO FRAME and flicks the needle, sendi vibrating back and forth. CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL Drew sitting at the table in house, the acupuncture needle in his arm and his face pen sad. Kwan busies himself around the needle, trying to all pain of Drew's bruises. KWAN
Next time we get that guy... DREW
(shaking his head) No next time, Master. Maybe... (big sigh) ... you should find a new student. I just can't do it  I'm not getting any better! KWAN (CONT'D)
Don't talk like that. At Shaolin... He pauses, and decides not to tell another Shaolin Temple looks at him funny  this is very against his character. KWAN (CONT'D)

I saw a Shaolin monk once. I was only 5 years old at the time, but I remember it like it was yesterday. I was coming back from the market with my father. Soldiers stopped us and were taking the food we had just bought. It was all we had left to eat  no more money. These were hard times in China, people were selling their children for food, and the soldiers had no right. Who can stop soldiers with guns, though? Yes? He pauses, and takes a sip of tea, checking the needle, a and turning it slightly this way and that. KWAN (CONT'D)

Just as the soldiers were leaving, a monk stepped out of the crowd and told them very calmly to put the food back. Well, naturally, they didn't. They pushed the monk, and the next thing I knew the soldiers were in the street, and the food was back in my father's arms. 5 soldiers, and they were in a heap on the ground, their blood mixing with the dust of the street. Kwan smiles with the memory  it is a sweet and heroic one KWAN (CONT'D)

The crowd whispered "Shaolin", and he bowed to us, touched my cheek and smiled, then just walked on. I watched him until he disappeared in the distance. He was larger than life, a hero to a little boy of 5. I vowed then and there to become like him, fight for right like the Shaolin. He pauses again, looking at Drew. Drew meets his gaze, wo he is telling him this story. KWAN (CONT'D)
I never did, though. My family left China and ended up here in New York, a young boy's dream left behind in China. DREW
You mean... all the stories...? KWAN (nodding)
Made up. I never trained at the Shaolin Temple. When I realized my dream couldn't come true, I convinced myself that it had anyway. It was a small step to convince other people. DREW
Why are you telling me this? KWAN

I've given you all I can, and it's not enough. It was never enough. You're like a son to me, Drew, and you have all the potential in the world, but I can't take you where you want to go. Kwan takes the needle out of Drew's arm, and then rubs th it was with a cotton ball. KWAN (CONT'D)
There, that should control the swelling. He watches Drew, who is pondering what Kwan has said. DREW
So you're not a Shaolin? KWAN
No. DREW
Never were? KWAN
No. Drew nods, an idea forming in his head. A slight smile fo face. Kwan was expecting him to be angry, he never expect KWAN (CONT'D)
What? DREW
If you are not a Shaolin warrior, then I will become one. KWAN
What are you talking about? DREW
I'm going to the Shaolin Temple  they can train me so I will never lose like that again. Kwan feels Drew's forehead. A long beat here as Kwan stud eyes. KWAN
He hit you so hard, you're delirious. I'll get a cold cloth. He starts to get up, but Drew grabs his arm and forces hi DREW

(eyes intent) Don't you    see? You said    yourself I needed the right training     where better    than the Shaolin Temple? Wha holding me    here? I have    the chance to do what you couldn't.    I will go to    the Shaolin Temple. Kwan looks at him, realizes he's serious. He nods his hea the idea serious consideration. He smiles along with Drew KWAN
I must pay for your ticket... DREW
No! I'll make it there myself. KWAN

I grew up on the stories of the Shaolin, and you can be those stories. You can live my dream for me  at least let me help you. Let an old man make up for the trouble he's caused. Kwan touches Drew's bruised cheek, fatherly love in his e nods his head, then bows in the traditional Chinese manne DREW
Master...

head_text.subj: DREW AND KWAN AS KWAN HANDS HIM A "NORTHWEST AIR

text: As he packs for China.
As Kwan drops drew off at the AIRPORT. Drew takes his sui walks into the airport.

head_text.subj: DREW RUNNING ALONG BEIJING'S CHANG A

text: Bicycle bells ring loudly as figures dressed in the same ride around him, their faces covered with scarves and sur against the northern China dirt. CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL TIAN AN MEN SQUARE and the hu CHAIRMAN MAO on the front of the Meridian Gate of the For Drew continues his run, past a group of western-dressed l who watch him run by through dark glasses. Drew runs through a large city park, stopping to watch a older citizens going through Tai Zhi routines under the w willow trees there. Drew runs through an open air food market, picking his wa flipping fish, dead frogs and all kinds of fruits and veg People yell at each other, trying to get the best price. brushing his teeth in the street. A group of toddlers, st together with rope, walks down the street, their split pa glimpses of bare bottoms as they walk.
Drew walks up to it, a huge backpack on his back. He hesi moment, then starts forcing his way onto the train like e else. He manages to get in through a window.
There are no seats. Drew takes his pack off and sits on i Next to him is an old man, his teeth red and rotted from juice. The man smiles at Drew.
Drew watches the countryside go by. Temples, farms and ri slide by, with an occasionally glimpse of the Great Wall.

head_text.subj: DREW, BACKPACK ON, AS HE WALKS ON TH

text: He stops on the platform for a moment, a huge colorful Ch billboard in the b.g. A transit cop quickly comes up to h him into motion. Drew walks on, passing a sign that reads

head_text.subj: DREW MAKING HIS WAY TOWARD THE SHAOL

text: He stops at    a drink stand and orders one. As soon as h ringed with    people watching his every move  he feels a movie star.    The woman in the stand hands him a drink, money out of    his hand. DREW
Where is the Shaolin Temple? Shaolin? The woman just smiles and shakes her head, not comprehend
Walking aimlessly. He comes to an intersection and sees a says "Shaolin Temple" with an arrow. He goes in the direc the arrow points.

head_text.subj: GROUP OF GIRLS STANDING OUTSIDE THEI

text: Drew walks up and says hello. DREW
Hello, ladies! Can you tell me how to get to the Shaolin Temple? They titter with laughter, covering their mouths with the Drew is not really amused, however, he is frustrated and DREW (CONT'D)
The Shaolin Temple? How hard can that be? Geez, doesn't anyone speak English here?
As she pushes her way to the front of the group. She is a beautiful young woman. ASHEMA
I do. But wouldn't it make more sense for you to speak Chinese than to expect us to speak English? DREW (flustered)
You're right. I apologize  I've just been trying to get to the temple for a long time now. ASHEMA
Why do you want to find the temple? DREW

(not without pride) I am going to join the temple as a monk. Ashema translates this for her friends, and they titter a gesture to Drew's longish hair and laugh, and then make s at martial arts movements. ASHEMA (CONT'D)
I'm going that way  I can take you. DREW
You have a car? ASHEMA
The next best thing. (beat) This is a Chinese car. She pulls out her standard-issue black bicycle  she has c it, however, with some colorful additions. ASHEMA (CONT'D)
Hop on. Drew does, and they take off, the girls from the school t they drive off.
It is not the most stable ride  Ashema is struggling to k while Drew is doing his best to stay on the bike.

He is riding strongly, and she is comfortable in the back getting stares from the people they pass, but Ashema seem enjoying the attention. Drew hits a bump, and Ashema hold a little tighter. Neither of them mind  in fact, Drew sta for more bumps. He pulls around the corner into a wide area lined with dr stands. ASHEMA
We are here.

head_text.subj: DREW STOPS THE BIKE AND LOOKS BACK AT HER. ASHEMA GESTURE
TEMPLE FRONT, AND DREW TURNS IN AWE.

text: This is it  the temple he came halfway around the world t Shaolin Temple, the birthplace of the martial arts. DREW
Whoa! Ashema climbs off the back and takes the bike from Drew, his awe-struck face. ASHEMA
I have to help my grandfather with our stand. If you get a chance, come by later. DREW (distracted)
I'll try, but monks aren't allowed to be around girls. ASHEMA
Good luck. DREW
Shaolin monks don't need luck... (beat)

Hey, thanks a lot for the ride. I hope I see you again. They wave at each other, and Ashema pushes her bike off. Drew turns back to stare at the front of the temple. He i all sink in. After a moment, he picks up his backpack and heads for th door. He pulls it open and disappears inside.

head_text.subj: TEMPLE INTERIOR AS DREW OPENS THE HE

text: The muted half light inside is in direct contrast to the the day outside. Drew quietly closes the front door, and light takes over. He walks through the temple proper, and what follows is a temple shots, establishing the feeling of the temple:    the famous Shaolin monk painting, the depressi floor of    the training hall, the incense blackened wall temple,    the temple figurines, the red lanterns hanging ceiling,    a huge wooden carving of Bodhidharma, etc. No one is around. Drew continues to explore, looking for someone to talk to into another hall, following the O.S. sounds of CHANTING. Once inside this hall, he sees a group of monks, amid han burners and paper lanterns, sitting down on the floor cha rhythm. No one notices that Drew is standing there. The m are open, but they don't seem to see him. He stands there for a moment, then shrugs and walks out o He goes into a corridor, then passes the "Wooden Man Cham

head_text.subj: HE STICKS HIS HEAD IN, AND SEES ALL KINDS OF WOODEN STATU
HE ALMOST STARTS IN, BUT IS DISTRACTED BY THE SOUNDS OF T

text: All manner of training equipment is standing outside (woo posts, hanging targets, heavy bags, iron palm jugs, balan etc.). A monk, the DRILL SERGEANT (hereafter D.S.), is standing a wooden post, driving his hand into the wood. The post TREMBLES with every strike. Drew stands next to the monk, watching him intently. Agai takes no notice of him. DREW
Excuse me, Master. No answer. DREW (CONT'D)

Hello? Busy, huh? Still no answer. The man is just slamming his hand into t over and over. Drew sighs and walks on. He goes down a path, and floweri are on either side of him. He can see the "pagoda forest" distance. At the end of the path, a monk, SAN DE, is swee path. Drew walks up to the monk and bows. DREW (CONT'D)
Master, may I ask you a question? No answer nor response. Drew's kind of tired of this trea DREW (CONT'D)

What's the deal here? Is everybody deaf in this temple? Even if you heard me, you wouldn't understand, would you? Huh, baldy? Shine your head for a quarter? He walks off frustrated, wondering what he has to do to g He walks back into the chanting chamber.
The monks are still chanting. Drew stands there, listenin moving with the beat, until they stop chanting. Drew, thinking it was some kind of performance, claps his DREW
That was great! Great! The monks finally take notice of him, and they are shocke MONK 1
No tourists! Temple closed! DREW
So you can see me?!? Several monks rush up and start herding Drew towards the MONK 1
(very agitated) No tourists! No tourists! Drew stops their progress and makes sure he has the monk' DREW (CONT'D)
I'm not a tourist! I want to be a monk! The monk stops, his face a mask of shock. He calls to ano and they have a short conversation in Chinese. ADMISSIONS MONK
That's not possible. DREW
What do you mean, sir? ADMISSIONS MONK
The training is too difficult. Besides, Shaolin policy is no foreigners. DREW
I didn't come all this way, from America, to get turned away. I want in. I want to become a Shaolin monk. ADMISSIONS MONK
What people want and what they can have are often not the same. DREW
Not in this case. MONK
Oh, yes, especially in this case. DREW
I'm not leaving. Drew starts to sit down, intent on staying, almost like a going to hold his breath until he turns blue. MONK
You give me no choice. (to other monks)
Remove him. He continues in a stream of Chinese, and the other monks and physically force him to stand up and start moving him door. DREW

I just want to be a monk! Drew is forced through the courtyard to the front door. They pass the monk who was sweeping up in the back of the watches with interest as they open the door and force Dre it, out of the temple. He smiles.

head_text.subj: DREW LANDING ON THE FLAGSTONES OF TH

text: A group of people stop and watch the foreigner. The templ closes with a solid boom. DREW

Hey! What about my... The temple door opens again, and out comes Drew's backpac It lands next to him, but spews out a couple of pairs of and some socks. The people standing around laugh. Drew gathers up the clothing and stuffs it back into his sits there for a moment, then gets up and heads for the s and stands ringing the courtyard. He walks past a couple of the stalls, looking at the peop them. He doesn't see Ashema. He passes a tea stall, where is sitting down sipping his tea. The old man looks at Drew and smiles, and Drew is about t when Ashema stands up from where she was squatting behind ASHEMA
Drew? DREW
Hi. Drew sits down heavily, putting his pack down next to him Ashema places a cup of tea down in front of him, the stea from it. DREW (CONT'D)
Make it a double. Rough day. ASHEMA
What happened? DREW
They kicked me out...

head_text.subj: DREW, ASHEMA AND OLD MAN, STILL SITT
TABLE, NOW LIT BY CANDLES AND A LANTERN.

text: A bunch of tea bowls are scattered in front of Drew, as i drinking heavily. He points to his teacup, and Ashema sha head. ASHEMA
You've had enough. Drew's shoulders slump even more. ASHEMA (CONT'D)
Maybe it's for the best, Drew. You belong in America. New York. DREW
I have to do this. I can't go home, not until I'm a monk. I'd be even more of a disgrace... The old man talks to Ashema for the first time. He chatte Chinese, motioning towards Drew. ASHEMA
Not now, Bau Bau. DREW
Bau Bau? ASHEMA
My nickname for him. He wants to tell you a story about the temple. The grandfather keeps talking, even though Ashema and Dre don't want to listen. ASHEMA (CONT'D)
He is telling a story about a monk who was refused admission into the temple. It broke his heart not to be allowed to be a monk. DREW
What did he do? Ashema says something to him, and he continues in Chinese ASHEMA
He decided not to leave. He stayed in the courtyard until they let him in. DREW
How long? ASHEMA
A long time  through the worst weather. He just sat there, unmoving, through rain, sleet, snow. DREW
Did they let him in? ASHEMA
No. (beat)

Of course they did  what kind of story do you think my Bau Bau would tell? He stayed in front of the temple until they could no longer say no. He went on to become one of the most famous monks in the history of the temple. Drew sits there, thinking, letting it all soak in. He the and smiles. DREW
Please tell your grandfather, your Bau Bau, he is a wise man. And that he tells a good story. The grandfather smiles at him, nodding his head. ASHEMA
What are you going to do? Are you going home? Drew shakes his head. DREW
I'm camping out. He starts away from the stand. DREW (CONT'D)
In front of the temple. He walks off into the Chinese night.

The sun is barely coming up, and only a few shafts of lig illuminating the darkness. A figure can be seen sitting c in front of the door. It is Drew, backpack at his side. The front door opens and a monk pokes his head out to loo and he sees Drew sitting there. His eyes widen in shock, quickly disappears inside. Almost immediately, the door opens again, and the Admissi standing there, surprised and angry to see Drew sitting t ADMISSIONS MONK
Go home! You cannot stay here! No response from Drew. He just sits there, staring straig ADMISSIONS MONK (CONT'D)

Do you hear me? Go away! Drew doesn't move. San De, the sweeping monk, walks out of the open door, a him carrying a suitcase. He walks past Drew, noticing him there. He walks on. The Admissions Monk slams the door, angry.

head_text.subj: DREW SWEATING IN THE HOT SUNSHINE

text: Sweat is running into Drew's eyes, and he is trying to ke stinging.

head_text.subj: DREW BEING TORMENTED BY LOCAL KIDS

text: They are playing games around him, throwing stones at him with his hair and his clothes, touching the things in his (frisbee, football, walkman), etc.
As he comes out of the temple, chasing away the kids. When they are gone, he turns to Drew. DRILL SERGEANT
Will you give up? I think so.

head_text.subj: DREW SHIVERING IN THE DEAD OF NIGHT

text: His eyes are closed, and it is obvious he is very uncomfo

head_text.subj: SPIDER AS IT CRAWLS OUT TO SEE DREW

text: It lingers for a moment, then goes away.
She is giving him food, and all he is moving is his mouth not speak.
He is miserable, and he is looking at the relative comfor stands around the temple, where there is food, warmth and spirit is wavering.

head_text.subj: DREW BEING FED BY ASHEMA AGAIN

text: ASHEMA
Give this up, Drew! Please? No response from Drew. Just a small smile.
This time it stays even longer. Drew looks down at it and
Looking out the windows at the crazy foreigner in their c
As a school group comes through the temple. The children are tied together with a rope, and the teach to the crazy American. Drew has become an attraction!
They are marveling at his perserverance.
This time it doesn't seem to bother him so much.

head_text.subj: DREW WITH ASHEMA AND HER BAU BAU THERE

text: Bau Bau speaks quickly in Chinese. ASHEMA (CONT'D)
My Bau Bau says, keep it up! He is proud of you... Drew nods.
They are no longer tormenting him, they are playing aroun him. Drew is not moving, but he is part of their group.

head_text.subj: DREW, THE SPIDER NOW SITTING ON HIS HAND

text: Drew stares at the spider, his companion in the vigil.

The birds are keeping him company, and they are singing f ANGLE ON DREW, THE FULL MOON IN THE B.G. Drew's form is firm and solid, the determination in his e seen as he stares at the moon. He will see this through.

head_text.subj: DREW STILL SITTING IN THE COURTYARD.

text: The    old monk, San De, comes back, the same monk follow with    the suitcase. He looks at Drew, a little surprise face    at seeing the American still there. He doesn't st goes    into the temple, shaking his head.
Same as the first shot, all alone in the temple.

The door to the temple opens and out comes San De, alone He walks over to where Drew is, stares at him for a momen down across from him. Drew tries not to look at him. San De runs his hand across his bald pate and smiles. SAN DE
My head is shiny enough already, don't you think? Drew, in shock at his ability to speak English, sputters DREW
You... You speak English? I'm sorry, I was just goofing... I apologize, master. I didn't mean to make fun of you... San De shrugs it off. Apology accepted. SAN DE
What are you trying to do? DREW
I want to become a monk  they won't let me in... Hey, you're just a grunt, a janitor sweeping up and all, don't sweat it. It's not your problem... SAN DE
Why are you sitting here? DREW
I got the idea from a story about a monk who wouldn't leave. I thought... San De nods. SAN DE
Has it been hard? DREW
It was at first. I was uncomfortable, in pain, actually, but as time went on, I got... into it, I guess. The sacrifice made me feel... in control, you know what I mean? SAN DE
(nodding) Much of the training at the temple is in that direction  self sacrifice. Tell me more. DREW

At first I was really bored, and very lonely. But then, things changed. Maybe it's like hitting the wall in running  it was like I became part of the courtyard, and I felt powerful. Even the spider became my friend... Drew opens up his hand to reveal a spider sitting in his DREW (CONT'D)
It was an incredible experience  I said I'd do it, and I did it. San De, watching Drew intently, smiles at this last. He s bows to Drew. Drew bows back, from his seated position. SAN DE
I wish you all the best. DREW
Same to you. San De turns and goes into the temple, leaving Drew still the courtyard, the setting sun in the b.g.

O.S. comes the sounds of gongs and drums. A crowd has gathered in the courtyard. Ashema and her gra in the crowd, and they work themselves up to where Drew i Drew turns his head, and a procession of kids about his a older and some younger) come walking into the courtyard. The front door to the temple opens wide, and a column of in their best saffron robes, are lined up waiting to rece The young men who are walking in all still have hair, and carrying some baggage. They begin to enter the temple. ASHEMA

They are disciples. This is the last class for fighting monks at Shaolin. Drew, very concerned, watches as the monks-to-be file thr temple doors. The mothers and fathers of the boys watch proudly as the through. The temple doors close.
Who is crushed. His chance is gone. ASHEMA (CONT'D)

I'm sorry, Drew. It was a good effort. Drew is sitting there, trying to understand what is happe the door to the temple opens again. The Drill Sergeant ap doorway and impatiently motions for Drew to come in. The crowd has stopped and is watching the drama unfold. Drew gets up warily, expecting some trick. The Drill Sergeant motions again, wanting Drew to hurry u Drew looks at Ashema and her Bau Bau and smiles. He picks backpack and starts towards the temple, limping from sitt long. The crowd goes crazy, clapping and yelling. Drew runs into the temple. The door closes behind him.

The line of disciples has stopped, waiting for Drew. Drew in hand, takes his place at the end of the line. They parade past a line of monks assembled in the courtya the temple. As they walk by, some of the monks look nonplused, while put out by the fact that Drew is among them. Several of the disciples turn around to look at Drew, and are openly hostile to him. They file up to a raised platform, on which stand 20 monk holding a scroll in their hands, one monk for every new d A gong sounds, and the questions begin.
Who is asked... MONK
Do you accept the authority of the Shaolin patriarchs? DISCIPLE 1
Yes, without pause.
MONK
Do you renounce the earthly world? DREW
Sure do, master. You bet. The monk pauses, for that is not the ritual answer to the The Drill Sergeant comes up to him and whispers in his ea monk then continues. MONK
Will you abide by the rules of the temple, even if it means death? DREW
I do. The Drill Sergeant comes up behind Drew and WHACKS him in with his elbow. DRILL SERGEANT (whispering)
Answer "Yes, without pause." DREW (rubbing his side)
Yes, without pause.
MONK
Who is the patriarch of the Shaolin Temple? DISCIPLE 2
Bodhidharma.
MONK
Do you accept the shr fu at the Shaolin Temple as your spiritual leaders? DREW
Yes, without pause. The Drill Sergeant nods his head. MONK
Will a fighting monk ever use his skills for personal gain? Drew pauses, looking at the Drill Sergeant. The D.S. nods on. DREW
Yes, without pause. The D.S. puts his hands over his eyes. DREW (CONT'D)

I mean, no, of course not. Then, another gong sounds, and the quizzing is concluded. A figure moves down a corridor in beautiful robes. Everyo down, their eyes on the floor, to the figure, who is movi the raised platform in the center. Drew, also bowed down, sneaks a peak at the figure. It is San De! San De catches his eye and smiles slightly. He winks at D clears his throat. Everyone stands up again. SAN DE
Do these disciples accept the authority of the Shaolin Temple? DRILL SERGEANT
Yes, without pause, Master San De.
Who now knows that the monk he called a "Janitor" is the DREW
(under his breath) I'll be damned! The DISCIPLE next to him, GAO, pokes him sharply in the r GAO
Shut up! DREW
(holding his side) Oh, unbelievable, in the same place... SAN DE
Are they ready to begin their training? DRILL SERGEANT
They are. SAN DE
Then, let us welcome them into our ranks! Gongs go off, firecrackers are set off, and a special fla on the flag pole. A roar comes from the crowd outside.
All of whom are happy. All, that is, except for Gao, who at Drew. Drew, notices the stare. DREW
You got a problem, man? GAO
You, American...
When the noise subsides. SAN DE

Your training begins tomorrow. For now, your shr fu will introduce you to our temple. Welcome to Shaolin. San De walks away, and the disciples are split into sever "platoons". Drew is matched up with the Drill Sergeant, a also in his group. DREW
Great, just great. They are motioned to follow Gao out of the courtyard and temple proper.
Drew walks behind the other disciples, who are lining up robes. As he takes his place in line, a monk comes up to backpack. Drew resists, and a tug of war ensues. DREW
What are you doing, man? MONK
You must surrender this. DREW
No way, man! Get your own... The Drill Sergeant sees the scuffle and walks over. D.S.

It is unseemly to argue like this. Take the backpack into the sleeping quarters. (to Drew) Do not cling to material things  it is not good for your soul. He walks away, and Drew reluctantly gives up his backpack Drew lines back up, and is about to get his robes, when G over and takes them from him. Drew immediately shoves him to grab the robes back. Gao smiles and moves away, holdin up and away from Drew. Drew is pissed and ready to go after Gao. Before he can, another disciple, grabs another set of robes from the tab it to Drew, pulling him away from the confrontation. DREW (CONT'D)
What's with that guy? LI
Watch out for Gao. He's trouble. DREW
Really? I hadn't noticed... Why'd they let him in, anyway? LI
Who knows? Maybe for the challenge? DREW
No, that was me... They both smile and walk off.
THE CAMERA MOVES DOWN the line of monks, as their hair is in clumps. Drew is standing next to his chair, arguing wi about the haircut. DREW
Mr. James designs my hair, master. I don't think... D.S.
This will symbolize your final break from the outside world. DREW (CONT'D)
Can't I just wear a patch? The D.S. shakes his head, and Drew sits down, unhappy. The barber starts on Drew's head, big clumps of hair fall the floor.

head_text.subj: MONKS, THEIR HEADS NEWLY SHAVED, STA

text: They are running their hands over their heads. Drew comes building, his head shaved completely clean. DREW
What outside world? I don't want to be seen by anybody... He rubs his hand over his head, and then sees the others. Li is smiling. DREW (CONT'D)
If I look half as stupid as you guys do, I'm really in trouble...

head_text.subj: THEIR SLEEPING QUARTERS, AS THE MONK

text: A number of cots are lined up side by side. The D.S. has bed to each monk. Drew finds his bed, which is right next GAO
I want another bed. D.S.
Why? GAO (CONT'D)
I won't sleep next to the American. D.S.
We are no longer Chinese or Americans, Han or Mongol. We are Shaolin. Everyone is a monk. GAO (CONT'D)
Well, this monk smells! Drew unconsciously smells himself. He shakes his head. Li goes up to the D.S. and points to the bed he was assig LI
I will switch with Disciple Gao. D.S. nods, and then starts for the door. D.S.

Go to sleep. No talking! We have an early day of training tomorrow. Gao collects his stuff and starts off to the new bed, hit with his shoulder. Drew trips him as he walks away, all d secretively since the D.S. is watching. DREW
Jerk! Li comes over to the new bed, and in silence they get cli their respective beds. D.S. switches off the lights, then Drew stares up at the ceiling. DREW (CONT'D)
Thanks for what you did. LI
Where are you from? DREW
New York City. You? LI
Beijing. What is New York like? DREW
Amazing. I'll tell you about... GAO
Shut UP! DREW
Blow me! Drew waits for a moment, fearful that the D.S. will be co in. He doesn't. DREW (CONT'D)
Good night, Li. LI
Wan an.

All is quiet. Suddenly, a huge stick ENTERS FRAME, and it pauses for a Drew, before THUMPING down on top of him. Drew cries out when he is hit, and jumps out of bed, look around him. No one is there. A few of the disciples are m because he yelled, but there is nothing else there. Drew, belatedly, gets into a fighting stance, but no othe coming.
Who seems to be sleeping peacefully.
As he climbs back into bed, bone-weary. He lies back down

Drew stumbles in, bleary-eyed,    to relieve himself. He urinal, relaxing as he starts.    Suddenly, a huge stick across the rear end, the SOUND    reverberating through t Drew yelps and jumps, looking    around for the attacker. No one is there, and his underwear is now all wet.
CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL Drew sitting with Li and some disciples. Drew makes a face. DREW
You got to be kidding. The D.S. comes up behind and grabs the bowl from him. D.S.
You don't like it, don't eat it. He takes the bowl away. DREW (CONT'D)
I didn't say I wasn't going to eat it... Geez! He turns to the rest of the disciples. DREW (CONT'D)
Well, at least we start training today, right, guys? A chorus of Yeahs.

head_text.subj: DORM ROOM, ALL THE DISCIPLES CHANGIN

text: They are the standard fighting monk issue  suitable for m training. DREW
Wonder what they'll start us with first? LI
Iron Palm? SHU
Wooden Man, I think. WU
No, it'll be basics, first day. Horse stance, kicks and punches... When they are all dressed, they run out of the room.

head_text.subj: ALL THE DISCIPLES LINED UP, READY FO

text: In the b.g. are the fighting monks, going through their r
As they go through forms or free sparring. There are SHOT throwing stars, working with weapons, etc. It is all very

Who is more excited than all the others. ANGLE ON THE D.S. As he walks to the front of the group. In his hand he is shovel. D.S. Bodhidharma, the patriarch of the Shaolin Temple tau to train the mind, we first have to train the body.

head_text.subj: WU, WHO SHIELDS HIS MOUTH AND WHISPERS

text: WU
Basics, I told you. ANGLE ON D.S. Who motions to one of the monks behind him, who has a whe filled with shovels. D.S.
Each one of you take a shovel. DREW
We're using the shovels as weapons? D.S.
(smiling) Weapons... (beat) ... in the war on infection. D.S. motions with his hand, and in the distance is the la building. D.S. (CONT'D)
You will be digging today, digging our new latrines. DREW
Latrines? Why? D.S.

A Shaolin fighting monk-in training does not ask questions. He just obeys. The D.S. leads the way to the latrine building, and the d follow, each of them carrying a shovel. Drew is trudging believing what they are doing. DREW (CONT'D)
I came halfway around the world to dig latrines? I could have just joined the army...
Digging with their shovels. Their training clothes are al sweated through and dirty. Their shirts are off, and thei muscles are bulging and shining in the hot sunshine.

As he lifts up two heavy buckets of dirt on a pole, then pole on his shoulders, the muscles in his arms, shoulders straining. He walks off to the side of the area to dump i As he dumps the dirt, a pole appears and CRACKS across hi drops the buckets and falls to the ground. He gets up as he can, but there is no one to be seen.
As they are working hard on the latrines. Drew is teachin American song as they work. DREW (CONT'D)
"Ain't no cure for the Shaolin Temple Blues... " OR
"Working on a Chain Gang" OR (CONT'D)
"I fought the law and the law won" OR (CONT'D)
"16 tons" The monks are singing along with him. All except for Gao.

head_text.subj: DREW AND DISCIPLES AS THEY EAT THEIR LUNCH

text: It is again very meager: a bowl of rice, a bowl of soup a of scrawny meat. Drew looks at it for a moment. The D.S. is standing over his shoulder. D.S.
Any problems? Drew shakes his head and starts to eat, quickly.

As he loads up a two baskets of dirt onto his pole. He ge onto his shoulders, in pain, and starts to walk. Immediat D.S. is there in front of him. He examines the baskets. They are not full. He moves quickly and dumps both baskets of dirt. DREW
(shocked) What'd you do that for? D.S.
Do a job well or don't do it.
As they are in line for water. They each drink a large gl then move back to their work area. Drew is the last in li Drew gets to the front, the D.S. smiles and shakes his he D.S.

Sorry, all gone. Get some more. Drew stares at all the water spilled onto the ground, the at the D.S., then forces a smile. He takes the proferred water (made of wood, with pointed bottoms and large handl D.S. indicates that they are to be held straight out to t work on the shoulder muscles. Drew turns and walks away, himself. DREW (CONT'D)
I'm gonna get you, man. Oh, yeah... Gao is laughing as he watches Drew go.

head_text.subj: DREW FILLING THE BUCKETS IN THE STRE

text: Once they are filled, he starts back for the temple. His are straining from the weight of the buckets. He goes over the path to the temple, having to negotiate chasms, etc. After various trials and tribulations, Drew the temple, his arms incredibly tired. The D.S. is there him. Drew, determined not to show any weakness, raises the buc little bit higher. He comes to the D.S., proud and defian motions for him to put the buckets down. Without thinking, Drew, puts the buckets down, and they b over, spilling their contents onto the ground. Drew tries them, but he's too late. The water has all spilled out on ground. DREW
Don't tell me, I know. Get more water...
They are exhausted from their work. Drew is lying in bed, wide open, ready to get attacked.
As his eyes go closed, finally.

head_text.subj: DREW WALKING ON A RIDGE BETWEEN TWO
CARRYING HUGE BASKETS OF DIRT ON HIS POLE.

text: He is balancing as he walks.
Who is working at the other end. He starts across the sam They come to the middle: a stand off. GAO
Back up and let me pass. DREW

No chance, Gao. You back up. Gao smiles and shakes   his head. Gao starts forward, and in the leg with a leg   sweep. Drew tries to keep his bal fights a valient, but   losing battle. He falls over the in his buckets flying   everywhere. Gao wipes his hands o continues walking.
A huge splinter sticking out of it. He is in real pain. T walks over and looks at the splinter, and in one move pul D.S.
(heartlessly) Shaolin monks feel no pain. Rub some dirt on it and you will be fine. He walks away.

On a work break. They are watching the monks training in distance. It is all the more desirable because it is unat In the distance, a monk can be seen walking between two o They are leading him out. The monk continues walking until he walks right in front disciples. His face and body are covered with bruises and two other monks don't say a word, their faces grim. Li turns to the D.S. LI
What happened? D.S.
He failed to pass through the wooden man chamber. He must leave the temple. The D.S. walks off. LI (CONT'D)
The "Wooden Man Chamber"! The ultimate test of a Shaolin monk... WU
Did you see his face? SHU
Poor guy. GAO
He just wasn't good enough. I wouldn't be surprised if half of us go out the same way. The D.S. appears and motions for them to work.

head_text.subj: DISCIPLES, DREW IN THE MIDDLE, SITTI

text: The monk in charge of the chamber is talking to them. MEDITATION MONK

Breath in through your nose, out through your mouth. Imagine yourself sitting on the bank of a river watching your thoughts flow by. Clear your mind... Think of nothing. Drew sits, trying to think of nothing. He is not succeedi

head_text.subj: DREW WASHING DISHES, ALONE IN THE KI

text: He bends over to get a dish, when a pole comes and SMACKS rear end. He turns immediately in one direction, but gets from the OTHER direction. Drew is furious, and he can't even see the attacker. DREW
Come out, goddamn it! Show yourself! No answer, as we HOLD on Drew looking around.

head_text.subj: DARK BROWN LIQUID BEING POURED INTO

text: Drew is walking with Li, having just dumped their buckets large hole. DREW
So what is this 'night soil' stuff anyway? LI
Human waste. DREW

Oh, man! You guys actually use this as fertilizer? That's disgusting! They turn to go back, and there is Gao, balancing a huge night soil over his head, peasant-style. He is on the sam they are going to walk on. DREW (CONT'D)
Hi, Gao. How you doing? GAO
(a little worried) Let me pass. He reaches down and plucks a stick out of the earth at hi then closes on Gao a little bit. DREW (CONT'D)
There's something on the bottom of your basket. Drew pokes at the basket for a moment, right over Gao's h he JAMS the stick in, and holds it there. DREW (CONT'D)

Oops! I think I found the problem. (beat) A hole. Drew pulls the stick out and watches as the night soil ca onto Gao's head. They back away as Gao goes running towar where the night soil is deposited. DREW (CONT'D)
(to Li) Well, somebody sure smells!

head_text.subj: THE DISCIPLES ARE WORKING EXTREMELY HARD.

text: As they work, a group of fighting monks walk by after a w stops working and watches them pass. DREW
This is ridiculous. Suddenly, a bamboo pole CRACKS Drew on the shoulder. He t ready for a fight, only to see the D.S. standing there, t raised for another strike. D.S.
Back to work. Drew is about to say something, but doesn't. He returns t
He is sitting with Li and a couple of the other disciples and Low. DREW (CONT'D)
I've got an idea on how to get even with our beloved Drill Sergeant... They all huddle a little closer.

head_text.subj: D.S. AS HE WALKS ALONG THE PATH.

text: In the b.g. can be seen Drew, Li, Wu and a couple other o disciples. They are waiting for something. The D.S. hits the trip wire and suddenly two bamboo poles towards him, ready to slam him in the shoulders. With one beautiful move, the D.S. breaks both poles, shat they hit his arms. The D.S. hardly breaks stride and continues walking. He l once, and sees the outline of the group of disciples.
Who are up and running as soon as they are spotted. They who was watching from another area.
He looks around, knocks, and then goes in.
The D.S. walks into the front of the courtyard and addres group. Gao is standing off to the side, a smug smile on his face D.S.
You are all responsible for anything that happens within your group. What happened yesterday falls on everyone's shoulders. So, all of you will do double work...
The smug smile gone now.

head_text.subj: GROUP OF DISCIPLES SEATED ON ROUND P

text: Drew is in the center of the room, and the sound of light heard.
It is him, he is asleep! Suddenly, a bamboo shinai is SLAMMED across Drew's back, up. MEDITATION MONK
Bodhidharma meditated for 9 years without sleeping. Think you can manage 9 minutes?

head_text.subj: THE ENTIRE GROUP LABORING IN THE FIE

text: They are all singing "Chain Gang".

head_text.subj: TIGHT ON SEVERAL OF THE DISCIPLES

text: They are good workers, and they don't mind the hard work weather quite so much.
Working hard.
Who is holding court. DREW
We came here to train, not to be slaves! We're free men... MU
But we swore to obey them... DREW
An uninformed choice is no choice at all! MU
Huh? DREW
We have to stand up for our rights! If they don't even know we're dissatisfied, things will never change. GAO
They haven't changed for centuries, why should we listen to you? DREW
Are we men or mice? Sheep or the shepherd? WU
I'm with you! The others are with him too, except for Gao. They are rea explode, and Drew has the match. DREW
I'm for going to the Headmaster right now! They are all ready. They head for the door, but Gao doesn Drew stops at the door and turns to Gao. DREW (CONT'D)
You're either with us, Gao, or you're against us. No answer from Gao. They exit the room.

head_text.subj: DREW AND THE BOYS RUSHING DOWN THE C

text: Heading for the same place but from a different direction

head_text.subj: GROUP ASSEMBLED OUTSIDE SAN DE'S CHA

text: Drew goes to knock on the door, when it opens and San De there. The D.S. has just arrived. He looks at San De for instructions, but San De indicates that he will deal with DREW
Master San De! SAN DE
Who else? DREW
We have something to say... SAN DE
This is an interesting coincidence, as I was just on my way to your sleeping quarters to talk with you all. DREW
I request permission to go first. SAN DE
I think I'd better... DREW
No, really, I want to... San De holds up his hand. He is the final authority. SAN DE

Here at the temple,    we use a period of intense physica labor to test your    patience, and to teach you humility and self-reliance.    As you continue training, you will given chores every    day  remember the first time you sa me I was sweeping?    Physical labor keeps us humble.
Who tonight have been anything but humble. SAN DE (CONT'D)

You've all performed    admirably, and have learned an important lesson  to    obey your shr fu without question Because of this, I've    decided to begin your martial training sooner than    what is prescribed. Tomorrow morning. The disciples can hardly believe their luck. SAN DE (CONT'D)
And, what did you have to say to me?
Who is sputtering now. DREW

I... I mean we, just wanted to... thank you for the opportunity to be part of the illustrious history of the Shaolin Temple. (beat) Yeah, that's it. Right, guys? They all say "Thank you" as one, and then bow to the head their hands clasped in front of them. They turn away and the hallway.
As they increase their pace, almost running through the h their excitement.
Suddenly, it BURSTS open and in come the disciples, led b fan out into the room, Drew in the center. DREW

Gentlemen, this calls for a party! He runs to his backpack and pulls out a boom box with spe puts on some good old American Rock 'N' Roll. Everyone, but Gao, is moving in time with the music. Drew accomplished dancer, but the others are pretty bad. The entire effect of the bald-headed monks rocking out is Drew starts showing Li and Wu a couple of dance routines the swim, the twist, etc.). Everyone is having a great ti
Glowering, as he moves toward the boom box. He reaches for the "Stop" button. Drew blocks the arm, and a pushing and shoving match star GAO
You're trying to get us all kicked out! DREW

I'm just trying to have a party. Chill out! They push and shove into the middle of the room, a couple and punches thrown, then they face off, ready to duke it The party is raging, while Gao and Drew are the only ones to do battle. Just then, the door starts to open. Everyone freezes and the door, including Gao. Drew, meanwhile, has the presenc jump onto the boom box, shutting it off and hiding it wit
As the D.S. opens it and sticks his head in. He surveys the room, seeing the tableau of frozen monks, lying on his bed.
Who waves to the D.S. ANGLE ON THE D.S. Who knows that something is going on. D.S.
Go to sleep. Lights out. He hits the lights and then closes the door. In the semi- room relaxes in a collective sigh. Drew stands up and pac stereo. Gao walks over past Drew. GAO
It's not over, American.

head_text.subj: CHAMBER FULL OF FIGHTING MONKS, ALL
THROUGH THE SAME SET OF MOVEMENTS.

text: Kick. Punch. Kick. Punch. INTERCUT of feet striking the stone floor, depressions in testifying to the centuries of training this chamber has Through the door come the D.S., Drew and the others. They along one wall, watching the fighting monks go through th It is beautiful: powerful, graceful and intimidating. Their form done, they file out of the chamber, leaving th his group, along with one fighting monk. The D.S. motions line up as the monks had. D.S.
You will train 6 days a week, from 5 am to 9 p.m., alternating with work and meditation. Sunday afternoon is free time. D.S. lets that sink in, then motions for the monk to take MONK

In order to keep our bodies strong, Bodhidharma gave us a series of exercises and breathing techniques. Because the times demanded action, we developed Shaolin style wu shu from these exercises. He goes through a couple of martial movements. MONK (CONT'D)
The spirit of Bodhidharma remains. Training is like meditation. Be aware of everything, but aware of nothing in particular. Think not thinking. DREW
What do you mean, 'Think not thinking'? MONK
Non thinking.
Confused.
Who doesn't explain any further. MONK (CONT'D)
Your training begins today, in this most sacred of training halls. The floor bears witness to the efforts of fighting monks from centuries past.
Where there are depressions and worn spots, the result of of hours of training. MONK (CONT'D)

At the Shaolin temple, we forge our bodies in the fire of our wills. We adhere to a vow of non-violence, unless someone else is in danger... Follow my movements... He starts moving through a series of techniques, and the disciples try to mimic his actions. He is moving around t they are trying to do what he is doing. Some are getting it, some aren't. Drew, used to a more individualized type of training, isn it.

A hand COMES INTO FRAME, grabs the wedge and pulls it bac ground. PULL BACK TO REVEAL Drew, along with the other disciples, and throwing these sharp wedges into the ground and pulli out. Their muscles are bulging with the effort.
Filled to the brim with small stones. Drew is forcing his the urn in "Iron Palm" training.

head_text.subj: MONK ON A SET OF POLES

text: He is going through a complex form, kicking and punching, missing or faltering a step. Some of the poles are as hig off the ground.
He is less sure, but at least he doesn't fall.
Trying the poles. He starts out well, but he soon misses almost impaling himself on a pole. DREW
I can't do this! D.S.
Here at Shaolin, can't doesn't exist. Only won't.

Drew is working with his friend Li. They are moving throu of techniques, ending with a flashy kicking technique whi blocked by a special Shaolin technique. Each time Li throws the final kick, Drew gets hit, HARD. His block isn't working. A monk comes up to him. MONK
Block the way I showed you. DREW
(showing him a block) This is the way I was taught. MONK (CONT'D)

Do it this way. You won't get hit. Drew bows and turns to continue working with Li. By this however, the ranks have shifted, and Gao is opposite Drew Drew attacks first in the series, and Gao uses the block deflect Drew's kick. GAO
(menacingly) My turn. He attacks, and Drew gets to the final technique. He bloc he did before, and he gets slammed brutally by Gao. Gao stands over him, smiling.

head_text.subj: MONKS FLIPPING THROUGH THE AIR, DOIN

text: A monk is alternately falling down and kipping up, fallin kipping up. Drew's group is working on several very athletic maneuver which Drew is especially good at. Gao, of course, is havi trouble. Drew tries a flying move and falls into a heap on the gro very angry, and he hits the ground with his fist. MONK
Emotions cloud the spirit  eliminate them. DREW
This isn't martial arts  it's gymnastics! MONK
This is Shaolin Wu Shu. Continue. Drew sits in the dirt, watching everyone around him sail air and flip over the ground. He is not a happy camper.
The entire group is gathered in a sort of pit, on a hard floor. D.S. stands in the middle. D.S.
I want to go over some takedowns before we end for the day. I'll need a partner... He scans the group, and then points to Drew. Drew smiles walks to the front and bows to D.S. D.S.
Watch carefully as I take him down, using techniques from shwai jyau, Chinese wrestling. DREW (looking at ground)
Excuse me, Master, but there aren't any mats here. D.S.
Do they always use mats in America? The group laughs a little at that, and Drew's manhood is challenged. D.S. (CONT'D)
If you are scared, I'll get someone else. Perhaps Gao would assist me...
Who is already getting up, ready and willing. This changes Drew's mind right away. ANGLE ON DREW AND D.S. DREW
Let's do it. D.S.

Attack me straight on... Drew attacks, and is taken down brutally, smashed into th concrete floor. No attempt is made to cushion or soften t Drew gets up right away, and attacks again. Again he is d ground. This continues from all angles and all methods of
Who can barely watch the destruction.

The D.S. does not let up at all, taking Drew down hard each time. Every time, regardless of the i gets right back up. His eyes are dazed, there is a little coming out of his nose, but he keeps coming back for more Finally, after a high arcing back throw, a real thumper, all of them, the D.S. calls it a day. D.S.
Any questions? Good, that's all for today. Before anyone can move, however, Drew raises his hand as can, obviously in pain. DREW (CONT'D)
I'm not sure I got that last throw clear in my mind. The group gasps, knowing how much Drew must be hurting, a for his guts. Even Gao is impressed. D.S.
I said that's enough. DREW (CONT'D)
If you're getting too old for this kind of training, I understand. D.S.

Attack! Drew attacks, and the D.S. executes the manuever perfectl Drew down almost on his head. Luckily, Drew is able to tw last moment and take the impact on his already bruised sh moans and groans and lies there. DREW (CONT'D)
I think I've got it now. Xie Xie! The group disburses, shaking their heads in wonder. Li co Drew, who is still lying on the ground. LI
Are you trying to kill yourself? DREW

He hurts more than me, he's just not bleeding, that's all. He tries to get up, but moans in pain and falls back down Li helps him up and takes him to the showers. ANGLE ON D.S. Watching them go. There is a slight smile on his face.

head_text.subj: LI RUBBING THE BRUISE ON DREW'S SHOU

text: It is huge, and looks really painful. LI
If you go to San De, he can send you to a doctor... Drew pulls away and stands up. He backs up to the wall of dormitory, right underneath a window. DREW
I appreciate your concern, Li, but it's not that serious. I'm all right. Just as he is talking, Gao comes to the window with a pan water (from washing the floor of the dorm).
Hhe smiles, then pours the huge bucket over the edge, dou
As the dirty water hits him, drenching him.
It is huge, and the water is crashing down from high abov
He is going through martial arts techniques as the water onto him.
As they stand on the bank. D.S.

Concentrate on your stance. All I want you to do is try to hold your stance. Li, you're first. Li smiles and walks into the waterfall, using a walkway t behind the thundering water. He moves into the water a little, and gets into a deep ho He stand there, immovable. After a moment, he turns to lo ANGLE ON D.S. Who motions him farther into the water.
Who nods his head and walks into the thundering water. As gets into the main stream of water, he is forced off the falls about 20 feet into the pool below. D.S.
Next... Each of them try it in turn. Everyone fails. Gao goes in, and he manages to stand under the impact of for a moment, before he too succumbs and goes down into t

It's his turn. He walks to the waterfall and goes in. He umbrella he stashed behind the waterfall (imprinted with GIANTS NFL" logo on it  unmistakably American). He walks into the waterfall, and the umbrella works for a Drew is holding it with both hands, and he gets into a de stance. He turns to smile at the D.S., and then waves at the othe as he takes a hand off the handle of the umbrella, the wa him and off he goes into the pool. He lands with a huge splash, doing a painful bellow flop. to the surface, still clutching the now- destroyed umbrel smiles at the other disciples, who are still swimming, sh DREW
Thought I'd join you guys.
Drew is in with the group. Gao and Drew are chosen to do exercise together. D.S.

In this exercise, you try to touch your partner's chest lightly, and your partner tries to block. The group gets started doing the drill, and Gao is almost Drew's chest in with his blows. He is so close to Drew th doesn't have a chance to block it. On the last strike, Dr back to the ground. The D.S. is there immediately. D.S.
Something wrong? Drew shakes his head and gets back up. D.S.

Switch! Now it's Drew's turn to strike, and he tries to hit Gao w amount of force as he did, but Gao avoids his attack, thr off balance. He throws another punch out, and Gao grabs i Drew falls to the floor again. A monk who was watching wa MONK
The goal of this drill is not to hurt your partner. Just try to tap his chest. DREW
I know, but... MONK
Then do it that way... The Monk walks away, shaking his head.

head_text.subj: TEMPLE COURTYARD, EMPTY EXCEPT FOR D

text: Drew is flipping it in a bunch of different ways, and Li watching him. To the side of the courtyard are two brooms leaning again DREW
This sure beats sweeping...

Floating past temple statues and ancient Chinese decorati missing them. Drew makes an acrobatic catch and then flicks it back to than he should have. It heads for an ancient statue and s dead center, right in the face. The statue starts to tip! Drew and Li rush for the statue and catch it, just before over and smashes on the ground. They look at each other, thanking their lucky stars the s fall. They start to throw the frisbee again, when Drew sp coming towards them. Drew stashes the frisbee in his shirt and grabs the broom He tosses one to Li and they just begin sweeping again wh rounds the corner. The D.S. knows something is going on, but they look so in D.S.
Sweep the main chamber, Drew. DREW (CONT'D)
Yes, master. He bows and smiles goodbye to Li. He walks into the main chamber.

This is the chamber where they had their first workout, a stands there for a moment, soaking up the tradition of it He walks to an area of the chamber under the famous paint stands staring at it. QUICK CUTS to different ANGLES of the painting.

Who begins to sweep. His broom is going over the depressions where the monks t soon he loses his desire to sweep. He takes the broom in a weapon and starts to spin it, going through a martial a his feet moving naturally into the depressions in the flo He finishes with a flourish, having moved into a shadowy corner, and then bows to an imaginary crowd, using the br microphone. DREW (imitating an announcer)
Presenting, the greatest fighter in the history of the Shaolin temple... Drew Carson! Drew holds his broom over his head, nodding his head to t crowd.

The crowd is going wild. Just then, out of the shadows comes an attacking staff, S Drew's unprotected stomach! Drew, ready to double over in pain, hears the staff hit t and stands up straight, adjusting the frisbee that saved Before he can react, the staff SMACKS him in the back of sends him pitching to the floor.
As he lands face down in the pile of dust and dirt he alr up.

head_text.subj: TEMPLE COURTYARD, THE SUN SETTING IN

text: Drew is standing in front of a painting-statue of Bodhidh which he is made to look extremely fierce. San De walks up behind Drew and stands there for a moment
He was an amazing monk...
Yeah, what's up with him?
Come with me... San De walks away, and Drew follows him.

head_text.subj: INT. SAN DE'S CHAMBERS SAME NIGHT

text: The room is filled with paintings and scrolls. A Golden S a place of honor. San De    puts the tea    leaves into the pot, then soaks water.    He pours the    water out, then repeats the pro times.    His movements    are all very precise and caref looks    like a martial    art kata. SAN DE
Legend states that Bodhidharma gave us tea. Once, while meditating, Bodhidharma fell asleep, a natural reaction we all have to fight against. San De looks pointedly at Drew, who doesn't meet his eyes

When he awoke, he was so enraged at his eyelids for betraying him, he tore them off and threw them to the ground. (beat) From those eyelids grew the first tea bush. You see, even the leaves look like eyelids. San De shows Drew a tea leaf. DREW
Impossible. SAN DE
Nothing is impossible if your spirit is pure, and your will is strong. The tea is ready, and San De begins to pour for Drew. SAN DE (CONT'D)
I understand you've been questioning some of the teachings of the temple... DREW
It's just not the way I was taught... San De keeps pouring into Drew's cup. It is getting to th De is not stopping. DREW (CONT'D)
Master! Stop! No more will go in! San De continues pouring until the tea runs all over the SAN DE

Exactly! You are like this cup, full of what you have learned. How can we show you Shaolin unless you first empty your cup? He picks up the cup and tosses the tea through an open wi pours into the empty cup. SAN DE (CONT'D)
The rules and disciplines of the temple exist to free you, not restrict you. They keep your mind from harmful thoughts. (beat) Drink your tea. Drew nods and sips at his tea.

head_text.subj: ONE OF THE INSTRUCTORS TEACHING A SO

text: His body moves with the wind, bending and swaying. Anothe attacking him with a hard style, and the soft style is ve effective. Drew and Li try it, and Drew is having a lot of trouble. to training hard style, and the soft style seems too weak D.S. comes over. DREW
It's not fighting  I feel like I'm dancing or something... This soft stuff is unnatural  Fighting should be hard, tough... The D.S. holds out his hand, in a tight fist. D.S.
If my hand was always like this, what would you call it? DREW
(after a beat) Deformed. He opens his hand, letting it go limp. D.S.
And if it was always like this? DREW (CONT'D)
Again, deformed. The D.S. nods and walks off, leaving Drew to stare questi Li.

head_text.subj: TEMPLE COURTYARD, WHERE ALL THE DISC

text: They are not dressed in their monastic robes, however. Th street clothes. It is their day off! A monk comes down the line, handing out hats to the disci put them on, and wait for instructions from the D.S. D.S.
Remember, let no one know you are disciples at the Shaolin Temple, but do not forget that you are. Dzai Jyan. They file out.

As soon as they are out, the serious faces break into smi they are teenagers again. Some of the disciples run off t relatives waiting for them in the courtyard, while a grou stick together. Drew is walking with Li, Wu and several others.

As they walk through the small town outside of the temple They pass by Ashema's stand, but only the Bau Bau is ther Drew bows to the Bau Bau, then slips off his hat, rubbing head for Bau Bau to see. Bau Bau laughs, and the rest of rush up to Drew, forcing his hat back on his head. LI
Drew! We're not supposed to... DREW

Chill out, guys! It's our day off! He bows to Bau Bau and then they walk off. They walk through the small town, checking it out. They walk through the countryside, enjoying their freedom Drew has brought a frisbee with him, and they are tossing

head_text.subj: GROUP AS THEY WALK IN THE HILLS HOUS

text: The hills are filled with Buddhist carvings.
As he walks by the carvings. The detail and the artistry

As they walk by a riverside park. The park is filled with a group of kids swinging into the river on a rope. Drew s watch them, then looks back at the others. They all shake their heads. Drew nods his. They continue to shake their heads. Drew starts running towards the kids, stripping off his s same time. The others pause for a moment, then follow his
As they swing into the river, trying to keep their hats o splash into the water. they are having the time of their
Resting on the bank of the river. Drew and the guys spot girls down the bank from them. DREW
Check it out, guys! WU
Girls! DREW
Good work, Wu. What tipped you off? LI (alarmed)
We are not allowed to have contact with females. It is the most serious rule of the temple. DREW

It's a stupid rule, Li. But... He is about to turn away, then spots Ashema as she runs d to the group of girls. He stands up immediately and start her. He is jogging, at the same time trying to straighten and his hat. Li starts running after Drew. The others follow. DREW (CONT'D)
Who hears her name. She looks around, sees Drew but doesn immediately recognize him. She looks around the park. DREW (CONT'D)
ASHEMA! Here! She looks at Drew again, and this time recognizes him. Dr and impulsively he gives her a hug, genuinely very happy Li arrives and pulls them apart. DREW (CONT'D)
What!?! LI
You can get kicked out of the temple for this... DREW

Who's going to tell, Li? You? He turns to Ashema, who has now backed off a little bit a looking at Drew, a smile on her face, but is pretending t embarrassed. The other girls are gathered around, gigglin DREW
(pointing at girls) Not the giggle girls again! How've you been? You look great! ASHEMA
(hiding a laugh) You look... funny. DREW (CONT'D)
Thanks. ASHEMA
How do you like the temple? DREW
Shhh... nobody's supposed to know. Li tugs at Drew's shirt. LI
We really shouldn't be doing this... DREW
I'm trying to show you guys a good time. (to Ashema) I guess I gotta go. It was great to see you. One of the giggle girls behind Ashema whispers something She nods and smiles. ASHEMA

My school is having a party this Tuesday night. Can you and your friends come? Li and the guys immediately hem and haw their negative re Drew smiles and takes Ashema's hand. The girls start to g He brings her hand up to his lips, and kisses it gently. DREW
We'll be there.

head_text.subj: DORM ROOM, LI STANDING IN FRONT OF D
REST OF THE DISCIPLES GATHERED AROUND.

text: The room is dark  it's after lights out. LI
Are you nuts? We can't go to a party, with GIRLS! DREW
Why not? We're working hard, we deserve some R & R. LI
DREW
We've earned this. Back home in New York, you don't say no to a party... Where's your sense of adventure? WU
What do you do at a 'party' with girls? Drew smiles, knowing that he has them. DREW
You dance, and talk. And have a good time. LI
That clinches it, we can't dance. WU
And we don't know how to talk to girls... DREW
(trying to sound like an expert) That's easy. You just talk to them like you would to the guys  you just don't tell them as much, and... not in the same way... Drew is in over his head. GAO
Like you know? DREW
Look, dancing's easy. I'll show you. We'll start with slow dancing. An OOOH escapes from the guys. DREW (CONT'D)
Dirty dancing! Giggles now. Drew pulls his boom box out of his backpack, searching for a suitable tape. DREW (CONT'D)
You guys grab a pillow for a partner, while I find some slow music. The disciples have grabbed their pillows. Drew pops the c his boom box and turns it on, low and sultry. DREW (CONT'D)
Just move in time to the music, nothing elaborate. Think of it as a soft form... The disciples move and sway in time to the music. They ar their pillows like imaginary girls.
Who is holding his pillow at arm's length.
DREW (CONT'D)
Loosen up, Li. She's not going to bite! LI
How do you know?
Who is really getting into it. He is dancing with his pil cheek, and occasionally sneaking a kiss.
Practicing their dancing and preparing for the party.
Who sits back on his bed, his hands clasped behind his he DREW
This is going to be great...
Still moving and swaying to the music.
Now asleep and in bed, still clutching their pillows like girls.
As it opens. The D.S. looks in on the room, and sees all holding their pillows. He shakes his head and then closes

head_text.subj: TWO BODIES FIGHTING, KICKING AND PUN

text: CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL Drew and Gao going at it. The disciples are paired off as well, but the only real actio this ring. Drew is getting tagged, hard, while the points he scores relatively controlled. After one particularly powerful sh stops. DREW
I thought this was light contact! GAO
Fight, you coward! Drew stares at Gao, then looks around for the D.S. He is other side of the training area. DREW

You got it. Before he can move, however, Gao attacks, slamming him fu the face. Drew almost falls to the ground, then attacks h battle is joined. The fighting is fast and furious, and soon the others see happening, and gather around. One of the monks comes over to break it up, but they continue fighting, wrestling, ki punching. The D.S. finally gets over to them, and without moving a barks  D.S.
Stop! Drew and Gao immediately break apart, breathing heavy and daggers at each other. D.S. (to others)
Back to work. He turns and walks off, motioning for Drew and Gao to fol Drew follows immediately, with Gao behind him. Gao shoves

head_text.subj: INT. SAN DE CHAMBER SAME DAY
DREW, GAO AND SAN DE IN THE SHADOWS

text: San De is sitting down reading a Buddhist text. With a si it down. On the wall behind is hanging a Golden Sash. SAN DE
So soon? (beat)
Tell me what happened. Drew looks at Gao, and Gao looks at Drew. There is a paus is very uncomfortable. Finally, Drew speaks. DREW
It was my fault. I started it.
Surprised at Drew's confession. DREW (CONT'D)
Disciple Gao was better than me. Drew pauses, and Gao is even more surprised at the revela DREW (CONT'D)
I lost my temper. He was only defending himself.
Who nods his head and looks at Drew. SAN DE
Is this true, Disciple Gao? Gao looks at Drew, wondering what he should say. Drew loo nodding for him to say yes. GAO
Yes. But, I am not completely blameless... SAN DE
I didn't think you were... (beat)

The Shaolin martial tradition is built on challenges. We challenge ourselves, but we do not fight with each other. Never do we fight to see who is best  we train to be able to right wrongs, not to let our hands and feet express emotions run wild. A Shaolin never throws a punch or kick in anger. (beat)

Shake hands and let your emotions go. Gao looks at Drew, knowing that the anger is already long away in the shock of Drew taking the blame. They shake hands. Both Drew and Gao notice the Golden Sash hanging on the w occupying a place of honor. SAN DE (CONT'D)
That is the Golden Sash, the highest honor of the temple. It is awarded to the monk who has attained the pinnacle of understanding. DREW
The best fighter? SAN DE
Among other things. Fighting is only a small part of being a Shaolin monk. GAO
Yours? San De nods. SAN DE

Return to your training. Drew and Gao get up, bow to San De and head for the door. They get to the door at the same time, however, and for a jockey for position, trying to be the first one through t Finally, Drew tires of the game and opens the door for Ga DREW
Ten more seconds and I would have kicked your ass... Gao smiles and walks through the door. Just as he passes punches him in the stomach.
In your dreams...

head_text.subj: DISCIPLES GETTING READY TO GO OUT.

text: They are dressed in "street" clothes and are just pulling hats. Drew, instead of wearing his temple-issue hat, pull York Yankees baseball cap!
Now, we're ready! He leads them towards the window of their dorm, but stops gets there. He turns to where Gao is standing, all alone.
Gao, you coming or what? There is a moment of indecision, then Gao frowns, shakes comes jogging towards them.
I'm coming, just to keep you out of trouble!

Suddenly, a figure lands on the ground with a PUFF of dus In a crouch, Drew scans the area, then motions for the ot down. Immediately, other figures land with PUFFs of dust all ar soon as they have all landed, they move off.

As they    sneak    through the courtyards and training a temple.    They    are about halfway across from the fron temple    when a    monk comes walking towards them. He i bobbing     he    looks drunk. Drew shoots Li and Gao a questioning look. Drunk? In the They take refuge behind a couple of the columns and watch makes his way past, weaving and throwing kicks and punche tense moment as the monk comes uncomfortably close to whe Gao are standing, but he walks on.
(whisper) Drunken Kung Fu... Drew nods and leads them out of the temple.

head_text.subj: GROUP AS THEY HEAD DOWN THE DARK STR
TOWN. EUPHORIA STRIKES, AND THEY ARE HAVING FUN

text: It is the same school where Drew first met Ashema. The gu happy, arrive at the school, and the realization of what about to do sinks in. They stop talking and are staring at the building. Drew s the door, and nobody follows his lead. He stops and motio to join him. Nobody moves. DREW
Are we men or are we sheep? A beat, then the entire group bellows: GROUP
And they follow Drew, the shepherd, in through the front noises like sheep.

It isn't happening. The boys are on one side, the girls a other. The music is bad Chinese rock and roll. The only ones together are Drew and Ashema, who are talki center of the room. The disciples are all clustered toget at the walls and the ceiling. A group of giggle girls are around Drew and Ashema. A group of toughs are standing at one side of the party r observing everything that's going on.
DREW
Great party... Ashema smiles a sheepish smile. Drew decides that if they to have a good time, he's going to have a hand in it. He cassette tape, gives it to Ashema DREW (CONT'D)
Play this when I signal, OK? She nods and walks off. Drew motions for Gao and the guys over. They do, and when they do, Drew turns to the giggle DREW (CONT'D)
Ladies, allow me to introduce my best friends in all of China... He drags Gao over to one of the prettier girls. DREW (CONT'D)
This is Gao. And this wild man is Li... Drew does the same for Li, Wu, Su, Sou and all the others them to stand with the girls for a moment. When everyone off, he motions to Ashema. DREW (CONT'D)
Hit it! INSERT of Ashema's finger on the tape player "PLAY" butto
As the song the disciples have been singing in the fields Immediately, the disciples start moving with the music, a the Party is happening.

Who are now slow dancing to a romantic melody  some holdi girls closer than others. Drew and Ashema are locked in a their eyes closed. A hand comes in and taps Drew on the shoulder. DREW (eyes still closed)
Not now, Li... The hand comes in again, punching Drew in the shoulder ha Drew opens his eyes, and sees that he is surrounded by fi guys, dressed in dark clothes and with sunglasses on. DREW (CONT'D)
What can I do for you? TOUGH
Leave. ANGLE ON DISCIPLES. They have noticed what is going on.
DREW

No, thanks. He turns back to Ashema, but she is pulled back by the gi away from danger. The tough spins Drew around and pushes him HARD. One of t has already gotten behind him, on his knees, and Drew goe over the tough, landing hard on the ground, the wind knoc him. Drew gets up, wincing, not really ready to fight. DREW (CONT'D)

Can't we talk this over? The tough pulls his fist back to strike Drew, who has bee two other toughs, his arms pinned behind his back. Suddenly, a figure FLIES in and SLAMS the tough to the gr It is Gao, and he immediately sets on the other toughs. T ERUPTS in a melee as the disciples go at it with the vill The girls are SCREAMING as the boys kick and punch. The disciples are winning, having a great time, until the room SLAMS open and the HEADMISTRESS comes storming in, s the top of her lungs for them to stop.
As they all agree as one to hightail out of there. They g past the Headmistress and out the door, full speed.
As they climb back into the dorm room.
He lands on the hardwood floor, panting his lungs out aft After a BEAT, he lifts his head and looks right at Gao. DREW
Did you say you were going to keep us OUT of trouble? The group pauses for a BEAT, then they all laugh, relaxin

head_text.subj: GAO CARRYING A PLATE OF CHINESE FOOD
TABLE WHERE THE DISCIPLES EATING, THEIR EYES SCANNING THE

text: Gao sits down and looks around. They are all dressed in t training clothes, dirtied after a full day of training. GAO
I can't believe nobody's said anything! It's been a whole day! LI
We broke every major rule the temple has, how could we get away with it? DREW
I think we might have. If they knew, they'd have already gotten us! You guys just have to stop looking so guilty.
Who pushes his dinner away from him. WU
I've lost my appetite. DREW
Let's go back to the dorm for a few minutes, go over our stories in case they seperate us... He gets up to leave, and the others follow him. LI
Seperate us?

head_text.subj: IN THE COURTYARD ARE SEVERAL POLICEMEN, WAITING AROUND.

text: Drew and the others spot the cops, and walk quickly to th room.

head_text.subj: DREW AND THE OTHERS ARE FRANTIC.

text: DREW
Cops! Somebody called the cops?!? Before anyone can answer, the door opens and the D.S. wal room, his face serious. D.S.
Drew! Come with me to San De's chamber... He turns to go, but the others are on their feet, ready t Drew. D.S.
Just Drew. Drew looks at them and shrugs, then follows the D.S.

head_text.subj: SAN DE AND THE GIRLS SCHOOL HEADMIST

text: Also in the room are two high-ranking police officials. T Headmistress is yelling at the top of her lungs, and San sitting there, letting her vent. You do not deserve to leave the country as a criminal, but you cannot stay. Drew sits for a moment, looking back and forth between Sa D.S. His eyes are filling with tears, and he wipes at the DREW (CONT'D)

text: The door opens and Drew walks in, the D.S. can be seen in San De indicates one of the chairs for him to sit in. He SAN DE

Why did you come to the Shaolin Temple? DREW
(caught off guard) To train, Master. SAN DE (CONT'D)
Yet you rebel at every rule, and blame the training for your inability to learn and progress? No response from Drew, who is just looking down at the gr SAN DE (CONT'D)
You are like someone swimming in fresh water crying "I thirst!". What you seek is all around you. Don't fight with the ways of the temple, the battle is within yourself. DREW
Within myself? SAN DE

You must accept the responsibility for your life. If we force you out of the temple, you can always blame the temple for your failure  it never has to be your fault. (beat) Life without committment is no life at all. DREW

Live for the moment, Drew. The future will take care of itself. If you go through your days here, squeezing every last bit of life out of every minute, you need not fear failure. DREW
(after a beat) Then, it's up to me. SAN DE (CONT'D)
Yes. Your fellow disciples stood up for you. It's your turn. DREW

Don't let yourself down. He bows to San De and then leaves the chamber.

text: San De has an ornately embroidered golden box in his hand showing it to Drew. SAN DE
