Smiling as he realizes that it was all a test  every mome
They are expert fighters now, and they move through the c routines with ease.
Hitting the ground and rolling, then coming up and throwi shuriken at a target. The throwing star hits the target dead center.
Manipulating the spear like a master.
Up on the poles again. Only this time, squared off agains They move from pole to pole, throwing kicks and punches a other.

head_text.subj: THE GROUP OF DISCIPLES STANDING UNDE
SWELTERING SUMMER SUN IN FRONT OF A RUN DOWN FARM BUILDIN

text: The D.S. is standing in front of them. DREW
We've got to rebuild this? D.S.
No. (beat)
Tear it down. Smiles grow on the faces of the disciples. They rush into building.

Different shots of the monks tearing the building apart w and punches. Shots of Drew, Gao and Li kicking through wa doors, through windows, etc. Some the three of them destr others are seperate. Several shots of disciples as they c on particularly difficult things, using their chi, smashi bricks and wood apart. They are destroying the building, having a GREAT TIME! (NOTE: Great place for HOT song over this scene)
PULL BACK TO REVEAL Drew standing there, calmly, while tw disciples hang off his arm.

He is going nowhere in particular, just walking and think Suddenly, out of nowhere, comes the staff and the ATTACK. Drew calmly avoids the first few strikes, blocks a couple grabs the staff and PULLS. Out comes the D.S. into the night on the other end of the looks proudly at Drew. ANGLE ON D.S. As he smiles and bows in respect to Drew. Drew returns his bow.

head_text.subj: SAN DE WRITING BOLD, BLACK CALLIGRAP

text: The CAMERA follows the sweeping brush, as it ends with a The CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL the temple courtyard, whe and the D.S. are standing in front of the group of discip SAN DE
Only one trial remains before you become full fledged fighting monks. The Wooden Man Chamber.
They are remembering the stories they have heard about th SAN DE (CONT'D)
I warn you all, any monk who fails must leave the temple forever, and will NEVER be called Shaolin. San De pauses, letting this remark sink in. SAN DE (CONT'D)
Disciple Drew Carson, as you will return to America, and never intended to live as a monk in the temple, you need not enter the chamber.
Who rises to the challenge. DREW
Master San De, I am part of the disciple class, am I not? San De nods. DREW (CONT'D)
Then I must pass this final test. Furthermore, I request that I be the first one through. SAN DE
(very proud) Your request is granted.
In front of the entrance to the Wooden Man Chamber. San D are flanking Drew as he pauses in front of the door. Drew look at San De, and the D.S. smacks Drew in the back of t DREW (CONT'D)
What did you do that for? D.S.
My last chance  when you come out the other side, we will be equals. Drew smiles at the D.S.'s attempt to lighten him up. He t at the others from his disciple class, then opens the doo through.

head_text.subj: INT. WOODEN MAN CHAMBER SAME DAY

text: Drew pauses for a moment,      examining the room. It is wooden statues of monks,      all in different fighting p carvings are precise and      incredibly beautiful. Their hands, fists and legs are      fashioned out of hard wood very dangerous indeed. Drew gathers himself for a moment, then starts into the c

As it presses down on one of the stones of the floor. The attacks start  from all sides, as the wooden statues LIFE, spinning, lunging and striking. Drew is caught off guard, and is hit several times, drive the door of the chamber. The statues stop moving. Drew, a little scared, tries to remember the sequence of letting his arms practice for the attacks. There is fear in his eyes. He starts in again, and the attacks come again, but they different this time. Drew is clobbered. Driven back to the door, Drew slumps against the wall. Hi already bruised and bleeding. DREW (whispering)
I can't do it. FLASHBACK TO D.S. D.S.
There is no can't, only won't.
Including the one where Drew succeeded in evading them.
Who gathers himself, straightens up and takes a deep brea it out in a breathing exercise. DREW (CONT'D)

I am a Shaolin monk. He enters the chamber again, and the attacks start again. Drew, however, is prepared (both mentally and physically) He blocks, avoids, rolls, jumps and redirects the attacks making his way across. He is about halfway across when an especially fierce and comes crashing towards him. Drew, caught a little off gua adjusts and manages to jump and spin out of the way. Suddenly, as he turns and tries to get his breath, two hu spears are streaking towards him. Drew blocks the SPEARS arms, misdirecting them into the wall behind him. They THWOCK into the wall, sticking there. As he rounds a particularly difficult series of statues, ARROWS comes HURTLING towards him. Drew blocks some, avoi and catches one in each hand. He throws them down and con He goes past the few remaining statues, and is out of the Chamber. All that is left is to walk down a little hallwa the door. Drew looks behind him, then starts to walk. He goes cauti expecting a trap or a trick. Nothing happens. He gets to the door and looks for a handle on the door. H handhold near the top of the door, and pulls it with his Immediately, his hands is locked in and a panel in the ce right onto his arm, forcing it down. Drew fights back wit muscles, the veins popping out in his arms and neck. Behind him, a statue has started coming towards him, spin dervish. Its fists and legs are extended, and they are de The panel drops lower and lower.
As he relaxes his face, and forcibly relaxes his arm and letting his inner energy take over.
As it slows with a GRINDING NOISE, then stops.

Holding up the heavy stone panel with his arm, his face a completely relaxed. The panel goes back up into the ceiling, and the door ope The whirling statue slows, and then stops altogether. Dre with a hook kick and taps it in the face. DREW (CONT'D)
Not this time. Drew quickly walks through the door.

head_text.subj: CHEERING ASSEMBLAGE, SAN DE AND D.S.
SHOTS OF OTHER DISCIPLES GAO, LI AND WU MAKE
JOINING THE OTHERS AS FULL-FLEDGED FIGHTING MONKS.

text: Drew is there each time to embrace them and congratulate

head_text.subj: SAN DE AND D.S. STANDING BEFORE THE

text: There are a few missing from their ranks, monks who did n through the chamber, but the majority of them are there. temple is gathered to watch the ceremony. San De and D.S. are dressed in elaborate ceremonial robes After he goes through some complicated ceremonial movemen including the waving of smoking incense over them, San De hands SAN DE
You are now Shaolin. We welcome you into our ranks as fighting monks... A roar rises from the assembled monks, and fireworks go o around.
Where a huge red sheet is pulled back to reveal tables la Chinese dishes, wine and other foods. The party gets going and is soon in full gear.
As they congratulate themselves, and gorge themselves on tables of Chinese food.
They are enjoying themselves. This only happens once every couple of years, and the mon intent on enjoying themselves.
Who is walking towards the side of the temple, away from
Who sees him leave. He excuses himself from his group.
Who is walking in the bamboo grove, his hands behind him. up to him and they bow. SAN DE
Congratulations. DREW
I wouldn't have made it through without you. (beat)
You once asked why I came here, why did you let me in? SAN DE
Do you remember the story you heard about the monk who would not leave? DREW
Yes. SAN DE
That monk was me.
Who digests this. He smiles a little. SAN DE (CONT'D)
I would like to ask a favor. DREW
Anything. SAN DE

Before you leave for American, can you help at an international tournament in Beijing? The Shaolin temple has an entry, and he will be fighting men from all over the world  I'd like you to be there. DREW
No problem. (he smiles) Without pause. SAN DE

Now, a friend would like to see you. (beat) ... alone. From out of the bamboo grove comes Ashema, her hands in f and her head down. She is not sure Drew wants to see her. Drew looks at her, then back to San De, but he is already are alone. Drew walks to her, takes her chin in his hand and tilts i at her face. Her eyes are full of love and tenderness, an fear. Drew kisses that fear away.

head_text.subj: HUGE EXHIBITION HALL. THE MARQUEE RE
HUGE HALL, THE FLOOR OF WHICH IS CRO

text: One large raised ring is in the middle of the floor  the the finals.
Where Li, Gao, San De, D.S. and some others are waiting. in monastic garb. Drew and Ashema walk up to them, holding hands. Drew is d fighting monk's costume as well, and he bows to his fello DREW
Are we late? SAN DE
The fight has not yet started. DREW
Did you think he would get into the finals? SAN DE
Who could know? He fights the winner of the Western countries, which is why I wanted you here. DREW
I'll help any way I can.
As it parts to let someone through. Drew turns casually t the competitor. Slowly, a figure, followed by a large gro people, comes clear... it is Trevor!
Who is stunned.
Could he have known?
Who spots drew standing near the ring. He walks past him, place his face. Then, he comes back and walks right up to slaps him on the back. TREVOR

Carson! Drew Carson! I can't believe it! I come half way around the world, and run into you! I heard you left the city, but I didn't know losing to me drove you into being a monk! Drew is dumbstruck, and Trevor takes advantage of it. TREVOR (CONT'D) (to San De)
He take a vow of silence too? Nice hair, Drew. (he looks at Ashema)
If he took a vow of chastity too, honey, you see me after this fight, 'Kay? He puts his arm around Ashema and lets his hand slide dow rear end. TREVOR (CONT'D)
Wish me luck, huh? He walks off, and Drew, who still hasn't said a word, sta him. All of the monks are looking at Drew with questionin everyone that is except for San De.

As Trevor and the Shaolin entry bow to each other. The fi It isn't even close. Trevor is better than he ever was. H incredible, and he destroys the Shaolin fighter. Oblivious to the boos and whistles from the crowd, he pla Shaolin fighter, making him look like a real fool.
Who is watching the destruction. Behind his eyes, he is r humiliation.

Who finishes the shaolin fighter off with a devestating t and then immediately plays to the crowd, RIGHT IN FRONT O THE OTHERS. The referee comes over to Trevor, and raises his fist up Trevor tears his arm away and SCREAMS TO THE CROWD: TREVOR (CONT'D)
The crowd, which before was wild and booing, now grows qu TREVOR (CONT'D)
I want HIM! He points right at Drew. TREVOR (CONT'D)

I want to face the American who is now a Shaolin monk! I want to learn at the hands of a master! The crowd, who has seen Drew and heard about him for quit warms to the prospect. They start cheering for the Americ to face Trevor. TREVOR (CONT'D)
I want the American Shaolin!
Who doesn't know what to do. San De appears and puts a co hand on his shoulder.
Pointing and yelling for Drew.
Who climbs the ropes and goes into the ring. The crowd is crazy, eager to see the match. Drew, oblivious to the cro over to Trevor. DREW
I came to the Shaolin Temple because of you, Trevor. You humiliated me, and I wanted to make sure it could never happen again. TREVOR
So, let's see what you've learned. DREW (shaking his head)
I've learned that... there's nothing to prove. Beating you is no longer important. It was my ego that had to be defeated, not you. TREVOR (CONT'D)
Bull! You're just chicken! DREW
The arts should never be about who is best  they are too important for that. He bows to Trevor and starts out of the ring.
They don't know what's going on.
They don't know either. They want Drew to fight him. ANGLE ON SAN DE AND D.S. Who know what is happening and are proud of Drew, prouder have ever been. TREVOR
COME BACK HERE! You can't just walk away! Drew steps out of the ring and walks over to where San De standing. They bow, and the pride is shining in San De's SAN DE
Do you turn away from him out of fear?
Who is seething. TREVOR
I thought the Shaolin monks were warriors, not babies! Look at him  he is too scared to face me!
His face calm. DREW
No, master. I will not fight for personal glory, or for my ego. SAN DE
You have learned much.
TREVOR
The Shaolin monks are PUSSIES! Warrior-monks? Ha!
Who indicates trevor with a inclination of his head. SAN DE
You did the right thing.
TREVOR
How about you, baldy? Or you? He is pointing at Li and Gao and the others, who are itch into the ring. Gao goes over to San De, and shoots a ques at Drew. GAO
Master, the American is insulting the Temple, and the fighting monks. SAN DE (looking at drew)
What should be done? GAO (CONT'D)
Someone should face him in combat. For the tradition of the temple. San De looks at Drew long and hard. SAN DE
There are some times when a Shaolin must fight, and some people who will not learn until they are taught a lesson.
Who understands the implication of what he is saying. He smile slowly. SAN DE (CONT'D)

It's your call. Drew nods, then turns to face the ring, where Trevor is s standing, trying to get someone to fight him. Drew walks with Gao back to the side of the ring. He turn Li and together they high-five. DREW

For the temple... Drew climbs into the ring. The crowd is going crazy. Trevor has a predator's grin on he sits down in his corner to get ready to start the matc Immediately, his contingent of people start to work on hi drinks, etc.
Who sits alone in the other corner.
Who see the difference. Immediately, they mobilize the ot
Who pulls a drink from one of the men in the crowd, and r give it to Drew.

As it is flooded with monks. Some of them are massaging D (painfully), others are stretching his legs out, others w to bring air to him, etc. The referee signals for the fighters to come to the cente and he motions for them to bow to each other. TREVOR
Remember last time, punk? DREW

Nothing exists but the moment, and... (beat) ... I'm going to enjoy it. They back up, and the fight begins. Trevor attacks hard, but Drew avoids easily, using all so He continues to attack, throwing flashy technique after f technique, but he can't touch Drew. TREVOR

Stay still, dammit! Stand and fight! And he dances out of the way. Trevor is getting more and Soon, Drew tires of this game and decides to end this goes after Trevor, and it is immediately obvious that completely outclassed. Drew scores on Trevor at will, Trevor totally confused and helpless with a mixture of takedowns, flips and punches. Trevor drops to one knee, his hands down at his side, not bothering to defend himself. Drew grabs Trevor by the front of his uniform and pulls b right hand in a fist. He is going to put him out with a g fashioned roundhouse punch.
Yelling for the knock out blow.

Worried about this latest development. Instead, however, Drew smiles and lifts Trevor up and sha hand, putting an arm around him to steady him in front of Trevor looks into Drew's face, wondering why Drew would d thing. When he sees Drew's friendly face, he knows. To teach him a lesson. Trevor smiles and holds up Drew's hand as the champion. The crowd goes crazy.
Who also get the message. ANGLE ON SAN DE AND D.S. Who knew the message all along.
Drew and Trevor standing together in the center. The monk side climb into the ring to celebrate with Drew.

head_text.subj: DREW STANDING ON THE GREAT WALL, THE

text: He is doing the beginning of a Shaolin form. When he fini salute, a figure comes toward him. It is San De, and he has something in his hands. Drew bows to San De, and San De holds THE GOLDEN SASH out Drew takes it and San De bows to him. Drew can't stand it and rushes up to San De. He gives him a hug.

Who is not used to shows of affection. He is lost for a m his face softens and he returns Drew's embrace. They break and bow again, and San De moves off. Drew stan holding the Golden Sash, the rising sun of the first day of his life shining in the b.g.
Who comes up to Drew, taking his arm and walks with him a Great Wall.
